citeinfo.origin: Alaska Department of Fish and Game (ADF&G), Division of Commercial Fisheries, Management and Development Division
citeinfo.title: No. 194 - Stock assessment trawl surveys of Pandalid shrimps in the Kodiak Island and Chignik Districts of Alaska, 1985. By Leslie J. Watson and David R. Bernard. January 1987 63 pp.

descript.abstract: Included (but are not limited to): (1) Salmon abundance, catch and escapement studies (2) annual smolt studies (3) tagging studies (4) annual federal aid reports (5) special short-term or interim reports on equipment or methodologies, stock identification, management, life history, etc and (6) some annual U.S./ Canada reports.
descript.purpose: Publications in this series are usually technically oriented and additionally have the following characteristics: (1) timely reporting of mostly final data, although minor future adjustments are acceptable (2) content usually annual iterative or interim in nature (3) data in a basic form (but not raw data) may be archived

idinfo.accconst: Request for one or two pages of data and/or short reports can usually be accommodated.
idinfo.useconst: Republications of materials in this report series may be authorized by the department

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. citeinfo.title: The database on distribution and morphological and physiological characteristics of Northern Fur Seal caught at the North Pacific

descript.abstract: To make up this database, the Northern Fur Seal Slaughter Cards were used. These cards were filled during the research sealings conducted at all Western Pacific seas as well as in open part of the North Pacific Ocean, at the Hokkaido and Honshu islands coast. Every fur seal being taken aboard was given a serial number. Furthermore the information on the catch date, time, geographical position in Mercator coordinate system (degrees and minutes), number of animals in group where the given specimen was taken from, and water temperature (in degrees centigrade) were also registered. Each caught seal was attentively examined for presence of a tag (a metal plate with one or two Russian or Latin letters and a number of Arabic figures imprinted). Then length (cm) and weight (kg) were measured. After flaying the animal was dissected. In case of female, its physiological condition (nulliparous, primaparous or multiparous) was determined judging by its genital organs condition, and if there was a foetus, its position was also written in (left or right uterine horn). Then the sex (male or female), weight (g) and length (cm) of the foetus taken out of the uterus were fixed.
descript.purpose: Providing a home for permanent storage of the data and their use for biological studies on Northern Fur Seals at the sea period of their lifecycle.

timeperd.current: All available archival data collected by the TINRO-Center research staff during sealings for the period from 1958 to 1988.

idinfo.accconst: Access to the data is possible only after getting permission from the administration of TINRO-Center.
idinfo.useconst: Use of the data is possible only after getting permission from TINRO

cntinfo.cntpos: Director of Pacific Fisheries Research Center (TINRO-Center)

dataqual.logic: The data added into the database have been checked carefully up, e.g. ranges of sizes and some combinations, for example, the fact that a male of 10 years cannot weight less than 30 kg.
dataqual.complete: All data from the Slaugter Cards for the period of 1958 to 1989 are uploaded into the database. A number of cards was lost. Further revision is not planned.

srcinfo.typesrc: Paper cards. The data were partially supplemented by clasifications. For instance, based on the presence or absence of foetus, a female was considered as "pregnant" or "nonpregnant" respectively.

srctime.srccurr: Covered is the entire historical period when the registration forms were filled by TINRO research fellows.

procstep.procdesc: Database implementaion with use of MS Access and Oracle.

spdoinfo.indspref: Latitude and longitude in decimal degrees.

cntinfo.cntpos: Director of Pacific Fisheries Research Center (TINRO-Center)
